comment.author: 70251312@N00
comment._content: California's delegates may have been solid for Teddy Roosevelt (candidate for a non-consecutive third term) for the 1912 GOP nomination, but incumbent President William Howard Taft got the nod. Roosevelt, who had handpicked Taft as his successor but felt betrayed by the rightwing course Taft followed once in office, then bolted to the new Progressive Party, and became the "Bull Moose" candidate. The three-way split in the November election gave the win to Woodrow Wilson and the Democratic Party.
